info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 10:24AM CST until January 05 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 PM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow expected with the potential for severely reduced visibilities in open areas and snow drifting onto previously cleared roads. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Illinois. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 3 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions are expected to develop in open areas, particularly late tonight into Wednesday. Pockets of near white out conditions could develop along north south roads where unobstructed western exposure allows snow to blow across the roadway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong southerly winds could result in blowing and drifting across east west roadways in open areas this evening, but then conditions will deteriorate significantly late tonight with very strong west winds resulting in significant blowing and drifting snow across north south roads. Some potential exists for near ground blizzard conditions to develop in open areas late tonight into Wednesday, consider postponing unnecessary travel in rural and outlying areas. Snow showers early Wednesday morning could further exacerbate the poor visibility issues.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.
